text: Melanothrix semperi is a moth in the family Eupterotidae. It was described by Rothschild in 1917. It is found in the PhilippinesThe Moths of Borneo (Mindanao). The wings of the adults are similar to Melanothrix nymphaliaria, but are less black. The abdomen is yellow with black transverse bands.On the genera Melanothrix, Drepanojana, Melandergon, Paracydas, Cotana, Hypercydas, Epicydas and Nervicompressa of the family Eupterotidae with descriptions of new forms ==References== Category:Moths described in 1917 Category:Eupterotinae Category:Insects of the Philippines
title: Melanothrix semperi
